Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
CAN: The student can draw two figures, indicating the presence of two students who wish to communicate.
The student can include a simple representation of a string phone, connecting the two students.
The student can show an attempt at illustrating sound traveling through the string, such as waves or lines.
CANNOT: The student may not accurately depict how the string must be taut for sound transmission (string is droopy or not drawn tight).
The student might not clearly represent how the sound travels or what information is conveyed (may draw sound waves incorrectly or omit them altogether).
The student might misunderstand the concept of a 'long distance', thinking it only refers to visual separation, not functional separation (students too close together).

The student may include additional materials not needed for the string telephone, demonstrating a lack of understanding of the required materials (draws additional, unnecessary items around the string phone).
